News & Media

Read all about it! 

Hearing health care is in the midst of unprecedented change. Hearing loss is finally getting much-deserved  attention—in local communities, nationally, in the press, and in the halls of government. But all the changes we are seeing haven’t happened on their own. In fact, since day one HLAA has been  at the forefront of change. Through our advocacy efforts, events such as the Walk4Hearing and the HLAA Convention, our various communication vehicles, including Hearing Life magazine and Hearing Life e-News, and most importantly, you—our members, the HLAA name has become synonymous with effecting those changes that  benefit consumers with hearing loss. 

With hearing loss awareness on the rise, HLAA keeps you up to date on the latest news and happenings in hearing health care. Here you can find all the news you need to know about what’s going on in hearing health care and to get the latest updates on HLAA events and the news we are making!

Are you a member of the press?  

We always look forward to speaking with media outlets to keep them up to date too! If you’re a member of the press and have an inquiry please contact:

Meredith Resnick
Director of Strategic Communications, HLAA
Cell: 202.549.0807 
Email: mresnick@hearingloss.org
